hackathon-description-text: HackUVic is a hackathon hosted by the Uvic Web Design and Development Club at the University of Victoria. It's an event for developers and designers of all skill levels to build their own project from scratch.
hackathon-eligibility: You need to be a student to participate.
hackathon-rules:
Be nice!
 
Follow the MLH Code of Conduct: https://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Engineering / Computer Science Building, 99111 Ring Rd, Victoria, BC V8P 5C2, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: For bonus points, the judges will assign a score based on how beneficial they think the project will be to the broader Victoria community.
If the team does not have a working project no points will be given. Full points will be given for a live demo where everyone can try the team's project.
How technically difficult was the project to build and execute? How well was it executed? Were there any obvious bugs in the demo? Judges will briefly review the source code and assign a score.
At the end of the hackathon each team will give a short presentation and demo of their project.

hackathon-location-address: Engineering / Computer Science Building, 99111 Ring Rd, Victoria, BC V8P 5C2, Canada
hackathon-location-description: UVic Engineering and Computer Science Building (ECS)
